fields.description: as a user, we would like to make the  Sprint backlog view from the Company managed projects cleaner and organized than the  Sprint backlog view from the Team-managed projects.
fields.summary: Make the Sprint backlog view from Company managed projects more like Sprint backlog view from Team Managed projects

fields.description:
Please, add the ability to set visibility restriction to all the comments of the issues in a project.

This feature is required when all comments of the issues in a project should not be accessed by a specific set of users, as it's really cumbersome to tag each comment restriction.
fields.summary: Bulk add visibility restriction to comments

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Jia supports connecting to Office 365 accounts using OAuth 2.0. However, it doesn't support GCC (Government Community Cloud) accounts.

It isn't supported because regular Office 365 accounts connect to {{outlook.office365.com}} whilst GCC accounts connect to {{outlook.office365.us}}.

Therefore, the connection is not established and the mail channel can't be connected using OAuth 2.0
h3. Workaround

No workaround for the cloud environment
fields.summary: Office 365 using OAuth 2.0 doesn't support GCC customers in Cloud

fields.description:
h3. It is really problematic that 'reaction' notifications don't include the reaction. It forces me to wait for the entire issue to load and me to scroll -- just so I can see "👍"

Please just include what the reaction is, in the notification, in some way.
fields.summary: Include reactions in sidebar and email notifications

fields.description:
h3. Problem definition:

Email notification in text format does not show user name when mentioning a user in the comment.
h3. Suggested Solution:

Change the text format to show the user name and not the account ID.
h3. Why is this important:

Users that prefer text format cannot see who was mentioned in the comment.
h3. Workaround:

Change the email format to HTML.
fields.summary: Email notification in text format to show user name

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
"Create issue screen" is displayed in small size when using Jira via remote desktop. It also happens on Virtual environments like AWS workspace, Virtualbox. It needs to extra scroll to create an issue.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # login to Jira via remote desktop
 # open issue create screen

h3. Expected Results
The screen is shown correctly
 !image-2021-08-25-17-02-15-404.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Actual Results
The screen is displayed in a small size.
 !image-2021-08-25-16-57-32-728.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround
Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: "Create issue screen" is displayed in small size when using remote desktop

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Optional custom fields are displayed to be populated during move operation
h3. Steps to Reproduce
1. Create 2 custom fields (For example Single text field 1 and Single text field 2)
2. Create context for both fields such that the fields have the scope set to "Bug" issue type and all projects (Global)
3. Create a Jira project and create different screens for Story and Bug issue types.
4. Add the 2 fields to the Bug screen only in the above created Jira project. 
5. In the project field configuration, mark "Single text field 1" as "Required" while "Single text field 2" is optional.
6. Create a story issue in the project and move the issue from Story to Bug.

Note: Even though 2 fields are added to a single project screen, the field appears to be populated during the Move operation to bug issue type in multiple projects (even though the field is not added to the bug screen configuration in that project)

h3. Expected Results
During the move operation, only the "Single text field 1" field should be prompted to be populated as it is a mandatory field.

h3. Actual Results
We notice that both "Single text field 1" (Required) and "Single text field 2" (Optional) are displayed to be populated during the Move operation.

h3. Workaround
It is possible to continue with the move operation by only populating the mandatory fields. Not populating the optional fields would not affect the move operation.
fields.summary: Optional custom fields are displayed to be populated during move operation

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Global Issue Create UI appears cut off
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Press the 'Create' button in the top toolbar

h3. Expected Results

New Issue dialog stretches to near the bottom of the screen
h3. Actual Results

In rare cases, the new Issue dialog cuts off near the top, only showing a few fields at a time.
h3. Workaround

Select a different project; this will cause the dialog dimensions to refresh. You can then switch back to initial project.
fields.summary: Global Issue Create UI appears cut off

fields.description:
The customer would like to allow non-jira users to be watchers on issues and also receive notifications.

The customer was able to do it in the Jira server version.
fields.summary: Allow users without product access to be watchers and receive notifications

fields.description:
While there is a commentedBy field in jql, it does not work.

And in [one of the more recent questions |https://community.atlassian.com/t5/Jira-questions/CommentedBy-CommentedOn-don-t-seem-to-work/qaq-p/1239752]the accepted answer is to use a paid app, but if the field exists I dont see why it doesnt work and I need to get a paid app.

My use cases are:
1. looking for an issue I commented on but wasnt assigned to
2. looking for an issue someone else commented on
fields.summary: jqls commentedBy does not work

fields.description:
We use webhook in Jira DC a lot. Now we are considering to adopt Jira cloud and want to have similar webhook functionality in Jira cloud. We have A4J which is little more secure than traditional webhook feature in Jira cloud.

Even though in A4J, one can secure API by adding Authorization header, but that does not fulfil organisation security needs..

We are looking for MATLS feature which is to ensure connection are trusted from Jira Cloud to on-premise CI systems and vice-versa.

We use webhook to trigger CI pipeline if any configured events occurs.

 

More detail - refer https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JIRAAUTOSERVER-322
fields.summary: Secure 'send web request' action with MATLS in Jira cloud

fields.description:
When a user is added to the instance, on their first login, they get an option "Select the tools you use the most". Choosing a tool will send a notification to the admins.

 !Select tools screen.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Suggested resolution

Have the ability to disable this "Select the tools you use the most" pop-up to all new users.
The workaround is to use the Skip question button.
fields.summary: Ability to disable the "Select the tools you use the most" option during onboarding

fields.description:
h3. Problem
The .7z extension is not recognized as a correct file type and it is not available for preview

h3. Environment
Js
.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
Upload a .7z file  under any issue
Click on it to preview
It shows as audio or unknown file format


h3. Expected Results
Preview should be available by showing the right format

h3. Actual Results
preview not available and it shows as .audio

h3. Workaround
_(Add a workaround, if available)_

h3. Notes
No related GSAC tickets found
fields.summary: The .7z extension is not recognized for preview and shows as audio/unknown filetype

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

The Jira issue key overlaps with the project name if the project name text is long
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 * Create a Jira project with a long project name
 * Create an issue under the project
 * Open the issue

h3. Expected Results

The project name and issue key should be visible without any overlap:
 Project / <project name> / <issue key>
h3. Actual Results

The project and issue key overlap: [https://share.getcloudapp.com/bLuqwJbd]

  !image-2021-09-03-15-20-03-498.png|width=723,height=144!
h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: New issue view: Issue key overlaps with project name if the project name text is long

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
There is no language translation option for "Email Confirmation To" field in customer portal
h3. Suggested Solution
Enable language translation feature for "Email Confirmation To" field in customer portal
fields.summary: Translation option for "Email Confirmation To" field in Customer Portal

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

When sharing URL which contains text as .xxx through Slack (for example, when sharing IP address through 00.00.xxx.xxx), this might be rendered to different sites.
h3. Suggestion

It would be good to block (or to have the possibility to choose to block or not) the rendering of websites when this redirection is done to what might be considered inappropriate content.
h3. Workaround

It's possible to use * instead of x when sharing URL address: (00.00.**.** )
fields.summary: Block specific content to be rendered when sharing URL through Slack
We should use POST instead of GET when retrieving data for gadgets

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

The Emojis are broken in the mobile view of the cloud sites. 
h3. Steps to Reproduce

Add emojis in Comment, Description etc, and the emoji rendered is broken when issues are viewed from Mobile web (Both Andrioid and iOS). 

Eg:

!Screen Shot 2021-08-19 at 16.40.13.png|thumbnail!
h3. Expected Results

The Emoji is loaded correctly in the mobile web as it loads in Jira web (computer)
h3. Actual Results

The Emojis are broken when an issue viewed from Mobile web (Both Andrioid and iOS). 
h3. Workaround

Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available.
fields.summary: Fix Atlassian/custom emojis incorrectly displaying in Mobile view

fields.description:
Currently the Epic link drop down in the issue view displays all the Epics across projects.With too many Epics in the system it becomes difficult to choose the right Epic from the drop down.

It would be great if we can create a filter for these Epics, so that only certain epics are suggested in the dropdown.
For example: A filter to suggest Epics based on Label, Fix Version, custom field value etc.
fields.summary: Add the ability to restrict Epics suggested in Epic link dropdown based on certain filter

fields.description:
h3. Problem Description

Currently, while adding a comment, users need to enter the formatting with Wiki Markup. However, some details are not considered on new view:
 E.g.:
 * Create an automation rule to add the comment. It expects Wiki Markup:
{code:java}
!image.png|align=left!{code}

 * The comment will be added and image will be on the center of the comment

h3. Suggested Solution

Support ADF on the automations
h3. Workaround

N/A
fields.summary: Support ADF on the automations

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Copied from [ACJIRA-2449|https://ecosystem.atlassian.net/browse/ACJIRA-2449]

Our Jira Cloud Connect App is using the following scopes:

"scopes": [
 "read",
 "write",
 "admin",
 "act_as_user"
 ]
 Which are listed as follows in the "Integration Details" of the Marketplace page:
 * Act on a user's behalf, even when the user is offline
 * Administer the host application
 * Administer Confluence spaces
 * Administer Jira projects
 * Delete data from the host application
 * Write data to the host application
 * Read data from the host application

It is unclear to us where the "Administer Confluence spaces" scope is coming from (the app being a Jira app). It is not listed among the Jira scopes for connect apps. We found a post in the community with the same issue that did not get any answer.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create marketplace listing with an app that has `admin` scope.
 # Look at Integration Details on the marketplace page
 # There's Administer Confluence spaces despite app being Jira only

h3. Expected Results

No "Administer Confluence spaces" for Jira only app, even if those have admin scope
h3. Actual Results

Administer Confluence spaces present for Jira app that has an `admin` scope.
h3. Workaround

Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: "Administer Confluence spaces" scope shown for Jira Cloud Connect App

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Copied from: [ACJIRA-2448|https://ecosystem.atlassian.net/browse/ACJIRA-2448]

The endpoint is accessible by anonymous users and Jira users but customers are unable to receive responses from this resource. It is unexpected because there is no permission required by this endpoint:


 !image-2021-08-23-12-10-45-258.png!

Additional remark:
It's odd that this endpoint doesn't require OAuth Scope but requires Connect scope. 
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Call POST /rest/api/3/permissions/project as an authenticated user
 # Get 403 Response

h3. Expected Results

The endpoint should be accessible to customers.
h3. Actual Results

The endpoint isn't accessible to customers.
h3. Workaround

Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: HTTP 403 status code on /rest/api/3/permissions/project rest endpoint

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Emails from users without a license are processed as internal comments when they are part of the "Service desk Team" role in a JSM project
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Make sure that you have the default mail handler setup for your cloud site with the default options
 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! 
 # Create a JSM project and disable the Incoming mails for the project
 # Add a _user1_ to the _Service Desk Customer Role_ ad _user2_ to the _Service Desk Team_ Role
 # Make sure these are not portal users but Jira users without a license
 # Create requests from the portal on behalf of these users
 # From the user's email account, send a reply to the customer notification

h3. Expected Results
Both the emails are not processed by the Jira mail handler

h3. Actual Results
Email from user1 is rejected, but the email from user2 is added as an internal comment:
 !screenshot-2.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround
Make sure you add the customer to the Service Desk Customer Role
fields.summary: Emails from users without a license are processed as internal comments when they are part of the "Service desk Team" role in a JSM project

fields.description:
Having one single administration project permission usually is not enough for project customization, too granular is not also good but create three categories for admin privileges as follow:

 

 

1. Things that change the *project definition*.
2. Things that change *project access*.
3. Things that are *records* within a project definition.

Where:
 * 
 ** Definition **
create automation rules
integrate apps
configure apps settings for projects
edit project configuration
add/remove project features
place new boards on the project

 * 
 ** Access **
edit members for a particular project

 * 
 ** Records **
manage the components
view and create reports
create releases

For example, with this customization we can give developers control over versions, but not for adding people.
fields.summary: Create three administrative project permission

fields.description:
h3. Steps to reproduce:
 # Log into Jira using FireFox browser.
 # Copy data from Outlook.

 # Paste it on a Jira Issue.

h3. Expected Results:
 * Data is added to the Issue.

h3. Actual Results:
 * No data is added to the issue.

h3. Workaround
 * Use another browser, like Chrome.
fields.summary: Using Firefox, copy+paste from MS Outlook to Jira doesn't add information to Issues

fields.description:
Our workplace loves some of the add-ons like the sheets intigrations, and great gagets, but we administer Jira instances for many different businesses that do not need these subscriptons.

 

Having the ability to assign add-ons to select user/groups would allow us to buy more add-ons if we knew they would not be billed instance wide.
fields.summary: Assigning subscriptions to certain users

fields.description:
Extend clone issue action to optionally include cloning related issues:
* Stories in epic
* Subtasks
* Linked issues.
fields.summary: Extend clone issue action to optionally include cloning related issues

fields.description:
h3. Summary
In certain conditions, the underlying functions required for the `rest/api/2/search` to complete will time out. 
When that happens the response code is a {{500}} with {{Internal Server Error}} as message.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
This can usually be reproduced in significantly big sites.

h3. Expected Results
The request returns a status code corresponding to a timeout (for example a {{408}}).

h3. Actual Results
The request returns a {{500}} status code with {{Internal Server Error}} as message.
 
h3. Notes
Known conditions leading to this:
- https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-76460

h3. Workaround
Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: When the underlying functions required for the rest/api/2/search to complete timeout, the response code is a 500 - Internal Server Error

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When we try to sort a Date time field which is not set as "Searchable" in JQL. It throws an error.


h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a custom field of type Date time.
 # Make the "Search Template" as None. Refer screen shot.

h3. Expected Results
Should be able to sort in JQL

h3. Actual Results
JQL throws an error "An unknown error occurred while trying to perform a search."
Refer screenshot.

h3. Workaround
Make the field as Searchable - Date range picker.
fields.summary: Trying to sort on a date time field which is not searchable throws error in JQL

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

A PUT to [this API|[https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/jira/platform/rest/v3/api-group-issue-custom-field-options/#api-rest-api-3-field-fieldid-context-contextid-option-put]] returns 200, but a visit to Jira admin to confirm shows the option _not_ present.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # {{PUT https://asecurityteam.atlassian.net/rest/api/3/field/customfield_10273/context/10411/option with payload \{"options":[{"id":"12490","value":"Halp","disabled":false}]}}}
 # {{Observe response code 200, response payload \{"options":[]}}}
 # Visit Jira admin panel to confirm the new option.
 # Observe it is not present.

h3. Expected Results

Option should appear in the custom field.
h3. Actual Results

Option is not present.
h3. Workaround

Workaround is to ask a Jira admin to manually enter the option via the Admin UI.
fields.summary: PUT new custom field option returns 200, but option is not present

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

To find the issues inside an Epic users need to filter the story and then sub-tasks inside the retrieved Stories,
 * "Epic link" in (Epic-1, Epic-2)
 * parent in (<tasks retrieved on the query above>)

h3. Suggested Solution

Add the ability to filter Story and Sub-task based on Epic link.
 E.g.:
{code:java}
"Epic link" in (field = XYZ) and parent in ("Epic link" in (field = XYZ)){code}
h3. Workaround

N/A
fields.summary: Add the ability to filter Story and Sub-task based on Epic link

fields.description:
h3. Summary
A few automation rules keep running and never completes. 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
The issue is intermittent and does not happen with all the rules
 # Create a global automation rule that triggers when an issue is created
 # Add the "Branch o IQL" component
 # Add a log action with the branch to print "success"

h3. Expected Results
The rule executes and prints success for every object returned by the IQL

h3. Actual Results
The rule is stuck, does not perform any action, and keeps running.
 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround
There is no workaround at this time
fields.summary: A few automation rules keep running and never completes

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Users signed in using JSM Customer Accounts who view customised Issue Collectors don't see the custom fields on it. This has the effect that they cannot provide values for required fields, so they cannot submit the form.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Configure an Issue Collector on any project on a site with JSM (doesn't have to be a Service Management project; I've reproduced this with a Jira Work Management project). Use the "Custom" form layout, so you can see the "Summary{color:#de350b}*{color}" field. 
 # To test, create a HTML file that will load the Collector, using the samples provided on the Issue Collector's info page
 # Create or switch to a Service (JSM) project and use the Customers page to invite a new customer (I used a test email address for this)
 # In a different browser, sign in to the JSM Portal as the new customer
 # Open the HTML file in that browser and hit the "Feedback" tab

h3. Expected Results

You see the complete form, including the "Summary{color:#de350b}*{color}" field. You can fill the form out and submit it successfully.

h3. Actual Results

You see a partial form, without the "Summary{color:#de350b}*{color}" field. When you attempt to submit the form, you an "*Oops! Something went wrong...*" error.

h3. Workaround

The user can cancel the form, sign out of the portal, then view the form again to load all the fields.
fields.summary: JSM Customer accounts cannot access custom fields on Issue Collector

fields.description:
As we logged the activity under Log Work for each case, when we edit/add that activity, the pop up is not wider enough. See the pic below:

!https://community.atlassian.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/156453i180B60BF1AEB4E65/image-size/large?v=v2&px=999!

It will be good if could customise this pop-up in terms of size or widening the popup-up.
fields.summary: JIRA Service: Widening popup when editing the Activity

fields.description:
{panel:title=Atlassian Update - 26/08/2021|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#3c78b5|titleBGColor=#3c78b5|bgColor=#e7f4fa}
After some analysis, we've found that this issue has been duplicated by the issue at [+JRACLOUD-75921: Sub-tasks can be created under Epic+|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-75921]. This is a current and verified bug in *Jira Cloud*, please watch that issue for further updates and more detailed workarounds.
{panel}

h3. Issue Summary

The option to convert an issue to a subtask is allowing user to select an epic as a parent for subtasks.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create an epic
 # Create a task inside the epic
 # Inside the task → Actions menu → Convert to Subtask
 # On the Select Parent Issue: Pick the Epic where the task resides
 # Go through the steps, it will be successful

h3. Expected Results

An error should be displayed avoiding the user to select an epic as a parent for the subtask.
h3. Actual Results

Now the new “sub-task” has no parent.
h3. Workaround

Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Convert to subtask option allows epic to be set as parent

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When you try to publish a rule that has an archived project under its scope, the application will prevent the rule from being published, presenting an error message stating the lack of permission on a project depending on the action. E.g. comment on issue action
* Error message: *Either you or the rule actor for this rule is missing some required permissions: ADD_COMMENTS*
 !Screen Shot 2021-08-18 at 14.54.48.png|thumbnail! 

But, the real problem is not simply the lack of permissions, the real problem is that the project is archived. 

In case customers cannot find the offending project(s), they will need to reach our support for assistance.

h3. Steps to Reproduce

* Create an Automation rule, adding two projects under its scope. Publish that rule
* Archive one of those projects
* Edit something on that same rule, and try to publish it again

h3. Expected Results

The rule will not be published stating that one of the projects is archived, and will point to the project(s) that are archived.

h3. Actual Results

Automation simply states the lack of permission.

h3. Workaround

None at the moment.
fields.summary: Publishing rule that contains archived projects on its scope will not tell which project those are

fields.description:
Currently, no results are returned if we enter a value of a single line text custom field on the quick search. 

Just clicking on the search button to open the advanced search should return the issues related to that.

It would be awesome to display those issues directly in the quick search area.
fields.summary: Allow text custom fields to be searched from quick search / text search

fields.description:
Right now only project administrators can create and manage versions.

I would like to have the possibility to give this right to a lead developer who is responsible for managing versions. The lead developer should not get all rights of a project administrator.

So it would be great to have a separate permission for managing versions that can be given to a project role which is not project administrator.
fields.summary: Create a separate permission for managing versions/releases

fields.description:
We want the ability to remove Epics marked as 'Done' in the Epics panel from a Team-manged project. 

Right now if the Epic is marked as 'Done' and its child issues are also marked as 'Done' *IF* the issues are in a Sprint the Epic will *not* be removed from the epic panel, will be displayed even if they are in a 'Done' status.

We want the ability to remove an Epic from the epic panel at any time.
fields.summary: Ability to remove done Epics from Team-managed projetcs Epic panel

fields.description: We think it would be great if before going on vacation (or even if an admin can do it to) you could be able to mark your account as *Away on Vacation* for a set period of time (until JJ/MM/YYY) for example. The expected behaviour would be that nobody can assign new issues to you, and issues that are currently assigned to you get marked with a flag depending on settings you put in place on the project (ie if person is away, bounce issues back to Project Owner for example).
fields.summary: Mark as OOO / Away on Vacation

fields.description:
Currently `?` in Jira Cloud JQL text search is treated the same as `*` - represents one or more character.

This behaviour is different than in Jira Server search mechanism, where `?` represents single character.

We need to know if this discrepancy is a real problem for users. Please vote + watch this issue if you have experienced this problem and need this improvement.

We would also appreciate if you provide a real usage scenarios in the comments.

 

Regards,

Łukasz Jarzembowski

Jira Cloud
fields.summary: Align question marks in wildcards with Jira Server

fields.description:
Hello,

I chose "Component"= "Issue - Create - Global" but maybe the component "TWP - Editor" is a better fit (however I didn't know what TWP is standing for).


I am facing a lasting pain when I'm sharing a URL in Jira issues (whether it be issue description or a comment on an issue) : I'm struggling with the "link preview" that shows the favicon+title of the URL I'm sharing.

I would like to remove this behaviour in my Jira personal settings, or at least, have the ability to disable the "link preview" feature when I'm sharing a URL. I found a turnaround (CTRL+Z) but it is not satisfying as I am sharing many URLs on a daily basis. One more argument : in my case, I don't need the link preview most of the time (like 90% of times when I'm sharing a URL, because I'm working with developers who need the full URL). The link preview is useful only a minority of times, and is nice-to-have feature instead of must-have feature.

Here is a 20 seconds video explaining my problem in details : [https://www.loom.com/share/5b9efd7b0572479f86bb24a654d2f251]  (you can read the comments below the video on Loom)

 

Thank you very much for your consideration,
Maxime
fields.summary: Remove or customize "link preview" in descriptions and comments

fields.description:
Current Jira has only the "Browse project" permisison which grants access to see the project and all issues in it.

It will be useful to have a specific permisison only for the Project view so that users can just be aware that project exists and they can’t access the issue keys.
fields.summary: Ability to have permissions that restrict the issue view in Jira

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Screens when added to Create transition of a workflow do not reflect the same in the screens tab.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Associate a new or already existing screen to create a transition of a workflow.
 # Though this screen would not come into play, this screen is tagged to the workflow.  !image-2021-08-18-11-59-20-758.png|width=348,height=158!
 # Now when checking the screens tab, the screen does not show to be associated with a workflow.  !image-2021-08-18-11-58-25-790.png|width=520,height=112!
 # If we try deleting the screen, it, therefore, gives the following error:
 !image-2021-08-18-11-57-59-247.png|width=335,height=225!

h3. Expected Results

The screen tab should reflect the screen's association to the workflow in the screens tab.
h3. Actual Results

It does not show its association and therefore it's difficult to find where the screen is associated.
h3. Workaround

Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Screen associated to create tranistion does not reflect the workflow information in te screen's tab.

fields.description:
Currently, if an attachment is added to an issue with invalid characters in the filename, Jira will simply show a "Failed to load" message, implying there is an issue with the attachment upload itself, not on the filename.

Suggestion: improve treatment of attachment-related error messages to make it clearer to the customer what is causing the error.
fields.summary: Provide better/more detailed error messages for attachment issues

fields.description:
Views such as Issue Types display ALL projects for EVERY issue making it an arduous task to find a specific field and its settings. Having a Collapse/Expand All option would greatly improve the navigation.

Note that Issue Types is just one view which would benefit from this option. Other admin displays are similarly difficult to navigate.
fields.summary: Collapse All option on Admin views

fields.description:
h3. Problem definition:

Popup notifications in Jira do not go away on their own.
h3. Suggested Solution:

Popup notifications should go away on their own without the need to press the X in the notification box.
h3. Why is this important:

Adds an unnecessary step for the customer to close a notification.
h3. Workaround:

Manually close the notification by pressing X in the notification box.
fields.summary: Popup notification self removal

fields.description:
when moving sub-task to a new parent, the search box only accepts the parent's issue key, we would like to include the summary in the search as well
 !image-2021-08-17-09-32-45-872.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: search by summary when moving sub-task to a new parent

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

If the Owner of an automation rule is removed from an instance, they will keep receiving failures notifications when the rule fails.
h3. Suggested Solution

Display an alert or pop-up on the Automation Administration page asking to replace the users that were removed from the instance.
h3. Quick Tip

If you have a lot of rules and don't want to check one by one to replace the removed user, you can:
 # Temporarily re-invite the user to the instance and remove their access on site (disable it).
 # Access the *Automation Global administration* page ([https://<instancename>.atlassian.net/plugins/servlet/ac/com.codebarrel.addons.automation/cb-jira-automation-rules])
 # Click on *More Option > Transfer User*.
 # Follow the steps to *replace all references to them in rules, including the rule owner*.
 # Remove the user again.
fields.summary: As an Admin, I would like to be warned about missing rule Owners on my site/instance

fields.description: It would be nice to have an option in the Automation Rules that allows us to assign an issue to an agent who is On-Call, according to the schedule that we can see inboth, JSM and Opsgenie, we have a helpdesk and we have people working 24/7 in 3 diferent schedules, but the Automation rule only allows me to automacally assign the issues to the members of the Service Desk team, but not based in their schedules, it just assign them  according to the balanced workload, but we need to assign them, besides of that, in the agent's schedule
fields.summary: Create an Automation rule that allows to assign an issue to an On-Call agent

fields.description:
Hi there Atlassian!

We'd like to suggest that, if changes are applied to an issue on a post function, it gets logged on the issue history. This will help to clarify how does changes are being set, without going over the workflow for investigation.

Thanks!
fields.summary: Show changes from post function on the issue history.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

We see an error _*We ran into a little trouble. It might just be a hiccup. Try again in a bit.*_ when we try to view an app request that has more than 7 requests.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Go to  Apps>View App requests.
 # Find an app with that is requested more than 7 times.
 # Click on view request.

h3. Expected Results

We see the details of the app requests. 
h3. Actual Results

We see an error:
{noformat}
We ran into a little trouble. It might just be a hiccup. Try again in a bit.
{noformat}
!Screenshot 2021-08-16 at 8.28.37 PM.png|width=579,height=107!
h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Unable to view app requests when the app has more than 7 requests

fields.description:
h3. Summary

This appears to be a partial Regression of the BUG:
 * https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-65437

Adding a permalink into a comment on the same issue does not jump to the referenced comment on the set focus event when the permalink is selected, but rather nothing occurs and the focus remains unchanged
h3. Environment:
 * Tested in:
 ** Chrome Version 92.0.4515.131 (Official Build) (x86_64)
 ** Firefox 90.0.2 (64-bit)
 ** Firefox 91.0 (64-bit)

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Add a comment to an issue
 # When viewing a comment, select the "copy link to comment" option to get the permalink
 # add a few new comments with some random text to make the effect more apparent
 # Place the link into a new comment on the same issue
 # Select the link

h3. Expected Results

The set focus event takes you to the comment in the permalink
h3. Actual Results

The URL changes to the focused comment :
{code:java}
https://<<BASE_URL>.atlassian.net/browse/<ISSUE_KEY>?focusedCommentId=<COMMENT_ID>
{code}
However, nothing occurs to the view and the focus is unchanged

 
h3. Workaround

Currently, the only workaround is to either open the comment in a new tab or refresh the page manually, as clicking the link while in the same tab will not refocus to the desired location without the additional manual action.
fields.summary: Permalinks to JIRA Comments on the same issue Do Not Jump to Comment in JIRA Cloud

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

When a user is assigned in a custom field multi-user picker, the user is not receiving notification in the 'Direct' tab.

h3. Proposed solution

To receive a notification in the 'Direct' tab.
 !image-2021-08-16-16-40-12-377.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: To receive a notification in the Direct tab when a user is assigned in a custom field multiuser picker

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When you are typing a JQL search, Jira will display suggestions of values for fields, if you hover over an option, a black pop-up will appear pointing to the name of that value.

Currently, if you do that and then start typing for new values, the pop-up will not go away.

h3. Steps to Reproduce

* Start typing a JQL search. E.g. assignee = 
* Once the list of suggestions appear, hover over a name
* While you are with the cursor on a name, and the black pop-up appears, start typing to retrieve different suggestions

h3. Expected Results

The pop-up will disappear.

h3. Actual Results

The pop-up is stuck on the screen. 

Here is a recording showing that behaviour:  [^Search suggestions.mp4] 

h3. Workaround

Reloading the screen will make the pop-up disapear.
fields.summary: JQL suggestions stuck on the screen

fields.description:
Rather than having epics as swimlanes, teams and/or boards should be used and the epic label should be on the gaant bar.  

 

This is in line with all other roadmapping software.
fields.summary: Teams based swimlane view for JIRA ROADMAP

fields.description:
h3. *What is the purpose of this ticket?*

The Issue Create team would like to keep our customers informed of any upcoming enhancements/changes/modifications to the Issue Create experience via regular updates on this ticket. If creating issues is a core experience for either you or your users, we recommend that you please *WATCH* this ticket to stay updated. 
h3. *Why a ticket and why now?*

The Issue Create team is very cognizant of the fact that the changes we make impact a large set of our customers. We have received feedback from customers that sometimes when sizable improvements are made to the Issue Create experience, we don't give our customers enough of a lead time to learn, understand and adapt to these changes. This leads to frustration from our customers and the team believes a ticket a regular stream of updates will be a positive step towards reducing this frustration. Additionally, the team has a renewed focus on making further improvements to the Issue Create experience overall, so expect improvements to come to Issue Create faster!
h3. What is currently planned for the Issue Create experience?

 
||*Feature*
 ||*Expected Roll out date*
 ||
| | |

_*Note:* Expected roll-out dates are only an indication of when we hope these features will roll out to customers. They are subject to change depending on various factors._
h3. What has already shipped?

 
||*Feature*
 ||*Roll out date*
 ||
|[Modernized Issue Create modal|https://community.atlassian.com/t5/Jira-articles/Announcement-New-Issue-Create-modal-will-be-available-to-all/ba-p/1874003]|6th December 2021|
fields.summary: Upcoming Updates to Issue Create (Please Watch)

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Sub-tasks inherit their security level from their parent ticket.
Currently if you change the parent via rest api, the security level is not updated

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # change the parent of a sub-task via rest api to a parent that has a different security level
 # Verify the value of the security level - it has not been updated

h3. Expected Results
that the security level is updated along with the parent

h3. Actual Results
that the security level is not updated along with the parent


h3. Workaround
n/A
fields.summary: Changing parent for sub-task via REST API does not update security level.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When you request a user object from https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/jira/platform/rest/v3/api-group-users/#api-rest-api-3-user-get the example response does not describe accountType (although the schema for User does describe accountType). Not including accountType in the output is confusing.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Call https://myserver.atlassian.net/rest/api/3/user?accountId=5b10ac8d82e05b22cc7d4ef5
 # Compare the response format to the example from https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/jira/platform/rest/v3/api-group-users/#api-rest-api-3-user-get and compare it to the Open API spec for this API.

h3. Expected Results

The example should include accountType, as does the spec.

h3. Actual Results

accountType IS returned as expected.

h3. Workaround

Refer to the schema for the response type, or else build client code directly from the Open API spec.
fields.summary: REST docs for the user API don't include accountType in the example

fields.description:
The process to create a new project now requires 5 unneeded steps before you can select "share settings with an existing project". Once you select that option, all your previous selections are negated. 

*Existing Process*

With the new change to Create Project, I have to do this:

1. Projects > Create Project

2. Pick any template.

3. Click "Use template"

4. Click "Select a company managed project"

5. Select "Share settings with an existing project"

6. Select the project you want to base it on.

Previously, on the Select a Template page, there was an option to skip the template selection process and go straight to "share settings with an existing project". 

*Desired change:* Please move this option back to the Select a Template page, so we don't have to go through 5 unneeded steps before we can accomplish our task. 

*Desired process:* 

1. Projects > Create Project

2. Pick any template OR pick "Share settings with an existing project"

3. Select the project you want to base it on.

All the new templates are wonderful, but if you are just trying to copy a project, all that stuff is just in the way.
fields.summary: Move "Share settings with an existing project" to the beginning of the create project process

fields.description:
{panel:title=Atlassian update - 4 August 2021}

Hi all! 
A quick update from the Jira issue and Smart Links teams.

Firstly, thanks for your ongoing, candid feedback. Please rest assured that we are closely monitoring your feedback and discussing internally. 

I understand this issue is increasingly causing challenges for our users. I'm currently working with our Smart Links team to explore this problem space to better understand nearer term improvements. 

I'll continue to update this ticket as I have more to share. 

Cheers, 
Venkatesh | Jira Issue PM
----

Hi everyone,

Thanks for voting and commenting on this issue. Your feedback is key to helping us understand how you use Jira so we can continue improving your experience. We have reviewed this issue over the last few days, however there are not currently any plans to implement this suggestion.

While we understand the logic for wanting to have different default options, our current focus is on making the unfurl states of Smart Links richer both inside and outside the editor across our products. Based off customer feedback, this is where we believe it’s most necessary to focus our efforts in the short-term.

In the meantime, you can change the Smart Link back to a normal url by clicking on the Smart Link in edit mode, and selecting “Display URL” from the toolbar dropdown.

We will continue to track this ticket and feedback across our various customer channels. Please remember that [jira.atlassian.com|http://jira.atlassian.com/] is one of many inputs for the Jira roadmap. You can [learn more about our process here|https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/110373/how-does-the-jira-team-use-jira-atlassian-com].

I understand that our decision may be disappointing. Please don't hesitate to contact me if you have any questions.

Venkatesh Vasudevan
 vvasudevan@atlassian.com
 Product Manager, Jira Cloud
{panel}
h3.  

*Problem Definition*

On the new issue view, whenever you paste a link on the Description or comment field, Jira initiates a Smart Link that will attempt to preview this link. It shows the below link "Connect to preview link"
 !smart-link.png|thumbnail!
h3. *Suggestion*

Allow an option to be able to disable the Smart link by providing a "turn off/on" Smart link button, either on the Instance as a whole or on per Issue basis.
h3. *Workaround*

_Note: Current workarounds only apply when creating a smart link. As a user viewing a smart link there is no current workaround._

In order to remove the Smart link from rendering on the new issue view.
 - Paste the Google link for example, once it renders to preview the link
 - Press Ctrl + Z (Windows) or Cmd + Z (MacOS) (this will revert the link to a normal blue link)

Alternative workaround:
 - When inserting the link, be sure to use http:// instead of [https://|https:]. The Smart Card feature will not be activated, and upon visiting the URL, it will automatically redirect to https:// for these services.
fields.summary: Option to Disable Smart Links For Non-Atlassian Products in ADF editor
Issue collector javascript code incorrect

fields.description:
As a user I don't want to see the right side panel always. Could you please make it collapsible as left side section(panel)? Please refer the image

 

!image-2021-08-13-14-06-15-616.png!
fields.summary: Collapsible right side section (panels)

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Upon sign up for new site, I got stuck in "One moment, your site is starting up"
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Sign up for a new Confluence + Jira site
 # Stuck in "One moment, your site is starting up"
 # Try refreshing but nothing happens

h3. Expected Results

I expect some graphic to show, progress bar to load, and redirection to happen once the site is ready.
h3. Actual Results

Stuck in "One moment, your site is starting up"

See attached screenshot.
h3. Workaround

I did receive an email that my site was ready.
fields.summary: New site registration page is stuck

fields.description:
h3. Problem
When using Jira cloud app on IOS mobile, and when a screen is configured for a transition, if the field for the screen is set to a comment, the screen does not pop up.

h3. Suggested Solution
It will be great to see the same functionality available on the desktop, where a screen pops up for the comment input.

h3. Why This Is Important
It is important to have the same experience on all devices, especially when the number f users using the IOS mobile is increasing day by day.

h3. Workaround
_(Add a workaround, if available)_
fields.summary: IOS Mobile support for transition screen on "comment" field

fields.description:
Enforce the date picker format when selecting a date in the Jira new issue view and disable any possible manual typing to avoid incorrect dates been set.

[^typing a date manually issue view.mp4]
fields.summary: Enforce the date picker format when selecting a date

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When trying to export a list of issues from a very long query it fails with the error HTTP 400 Bad Request.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Search with a heavy amount of fields. In this case, we had over 80 labels, and 26 other clauses.
 # Try to export as CSV (excel)

h3. Expected Results

Should generate a file.
h3. Actual Results

The below exception is displayed on screen:

!image-2021-04-23-16-43-29-772.png|width=836,height=338!
{noformat}
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException: Request header is too large
	org.apache.coyote.http11.Http11InputBuffer.fill(Http11InputBuffer.java:766)
	org.apache.coyote.http11.Http11InputBuffer.parseHeader(Http11InputBuffer.java:921)
	org.apache.coyote.http11.Http11InputBuffer.parseHeaders(Http11InputBuffer.java:594)
	org.apache.coyote.http11.Http11Processor.service(Http11Processor.java:283)
	org.apache.coyote.AbstractProcessorLight.process(AbstractProcessorLight.java:65)
	org.apache.coyote.AbstractProtocol$ConnectionHandler.process(AbstractProtocol.java:868)
	org.apache.tomcat.util.net.NioEndpoint$SocketProcessor.doRun(NioEndpoint.java:1590)
	org.apache.tomcat.util.net.SocketProcessorBase.run(SocketProcessorBase.java:49)
	java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor.runWorker(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:1149)
	java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor$Worker.run(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:624)
	org.apache.tomcat.util.threads.TaskThread$WrappingRunnable.run(TaskThread.java:61)
	java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:748){noformat}
h3. Workaround

Saving the query as a filter enables the export.
fields.summary: Exporting issues as CSV from a long query fails with error HTTP 400 Bad Request

fields.description:
Currently, if a user is having *Administer Projects* permissions in multiple projects, and if the automation rule scope is restricted to these respective projects, the project administrator will not have an option to *_enable_* or to *_disable_* the automation rule.
As of now, the project administrator will be only allowed to *_enable_* or to *_disable_* the automation rule which is restricted to a single project where this user has *Administer Projects* permission.

Expectation: 
If a user has *Administer Projects* permission let's say in *Project A* and *Project B* and if the automation rule is in scope for both these projects, then the project administrator should be able to *_enable_* or to *_disable_* the automation rule from the *Project settings>> automation* section.
fields.summary: Allow permission to 'enable' or 'disable' automation rule to a project administrator for multi-project rule

fields.description:
Currently, the *Teams* field in Jira is used with _Advance Roadmaps_ specific to the Premium tier. 

This request is raised to request for a feature that will allow us to perform a JQL search on the Jira's Team, present under People.

 !Screenshot 2021-08-12 at 12.54.55 PM.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Ability to perform a JQL search on the members of a team

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Description field does not render table format when copy-pasting it from Excel file during the create issue. 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Click on create issue.
 # Copy the table (with columns and rows) from excel and paste it in the description field.


h3. Expected Results
Table format should be rendered in the description field when pasting it from excel.

h3. Actual Results
Table format doesn't get rendered. 

h3. Workaround
Create an issue and then edit the issue and past the table format in the description field.
Or 
Select the 'table' option in the description field during issue creation.
fields.summary: Description field does not render tables when creating issue

fields.description:
It could be possible to set fields in a way that:
 * A set of users can edit the field.
 * A broader set of users can view the field.

Similar to what we have with the project permission, Assign Issues, which enables setting the assignee.
fields.summary: Allow field configuration to set read-only capabilities to sets of users.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Excel attachment when previewed in Jira, does not respect the filter in pivot when using greater than or less than.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Have an excel file with the pivot filter (refer the file in the attachment)
 # View in Excel.
 !image-2021-08-12-01-54-44-662.png|width=218,height=138!
 # Preview in Jira as an attachments - results here differ.
 !image-2021-08-12-01-55-46-540.png|width=206,height=161!

h3. Expected Results

View should be the same in Excel and Jira.
h3. Actual Results

Different views in Jira and Excel
h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Support (>,<) pivot filters for excel attachments preview.

fields.description:
h4. Summary
At the moment, when populating a date/time picker field in the Jira new issue view, we see preset values indicating the format of values: https://share.getcloudapp.com/mXuKEEqR

If only date field is populated and the time field is left empty, the field does not accept any value and resets.

h4. Suggestion
Provide a message/suggestion in the UI for the date/time picker custom field to populate the time field when only date field is populated.
fields.summary: UI Enhancement: Date/time custom field resets when only date field is populated

fields.description:
h3. Problem
As of now we only support UTF-8 encoded files without extensions to be previewed under attachments.

h3. Suggested Solution
 Please support ANSI encoded files for attachment preview as well on the issues

h3. Why This Is Important
Customers can use different encoded formats depending on their business case and it is important to support them for preview

h3. Workaround
_(Add a workaround, if available)_
fields.summary: Support for ANSI encoded files for the attachment preview section

fields.description:
In JIRA, when we clone a parent issues containing sub tasks, user are given the option to automatically clone the Sub Tasks as well. However in Agile(GreenHopper) when we clone an Epic, the linked Stories does not get cloned as well. 

Since the 'clone stories' option is not available at the current moment, users will have to clone the Epic and each of the linked stories manually, which can consume a lot of time. 

Hence, it will be great if we can implement the option to clone an Epic along with it's linked sub tasks as well.
fields.summary: When cloning an Epic, add the option to clone the linked Stories as well

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

A single scheduled rule executes twice for some customers intermittently
h3. Steps to Reproduce

Difficult to reproduce.
 # Create a rule that executes once a day
 # Check the audit logs

h3. Expected Results

The rule executes once a day 
h3. Actual Results

The rule sometimes triggered twice on the same day at the same time with a difference of a 4-5 seconds
h3. Workaround

There is no workaround at this time
fields.summary: A single scheduled rule executes twice for some customers intermittently

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Setting dashboard item configuration through API can lead to inconsistent settings being stored, causing errors on later attempts to manipulate the dashboard.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Set a dashboard item's properties using [https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/jira/platform/rest/v3/api-group-dashboards/#api-rest-api-3-dashboard-dashboardid-items-itemid-properties-propertykey-put] , to something other than single-level object with strings for keys and values.
 # Attempt to delete the dashboard

h3. Expected Results

The dashboard is deleted.
h3. Actual Results

A 500 is returned, and internally a JSON decoding error is logged.
h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Setting dashboard item properties with API can result in invalid structure

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When trying to save a filter applied to a Filter Results macro, it won't work if there's a custom field type *Text Field (multi-line)* or *Select List (single choice)* __ selected/ added.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a *Text Field (multi-line) or _Select List (single choice)_* custom field on Jira and add it to a project
 # On Confluence create a new page and add the Filter Results macro
 # Add a filter for the project from step 1
 # Add the custom field from step 1
 # Try to save the settings

h3. Expected Results

Settings are saved
h3. Actual Results

Nothing happens and there's no way to save the settings
h3. Workaround

Currently, the only available workaround is to add the macro again, without adding the Text Field (multi-line) custom field.

Another potential workaround:
Use Jira Issue macro as a potential workaround. Here are some documentation: [https://support.atlassian.com/confluence-cloud/docs/insert-the-jira-issues-macro/]
After selecting the tasks to display using a filter or JQL query, we can use the table display option to customize the columns that will be shown like so:
!Screen Shot 2021-08-10 at 12.39.09 PM.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Clicking save on the Filter Results macro doesn't work when there's a Text Field (multi-line) or Select List (single choice) custom field added

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

in the [new Jira issue view|https://support.atlassian.com/jira-core-cloud/docs/what-is-the-new-jira-issue-view/], the Code Block Macro Includes Line numbers down the left side of the macro for multi-line inputs and it would be useful to have an option in the macro settings to enable or disable the numbering
h3. Suggested Solution

Add line number toggle option to code block macro
h3. Workaround

None at this time
fields.summary: Add option to toggle line numbers off in code block macro settings

fields.description: I'd like to preview Jira Templates before using
fields.summary: Jira Template Preview

fields.description:
User would like the ability to customise Split issue screen fields - what is visible on the form and what is editable. 

Related to JRACLOUD-64934
fields.summary: Ability to customize Split Issue screen fields

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When creating a *Sub-Task* if their Wokflow has the *Copy Value From Other Field* Post-Function with the *Copy from parent* option set & it uses a *Select List (cascading)* Field there is an error if the *Select List (cascading)* Field chooses a value with no second value.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a *Select List (cascading)* Field with some options with no second level, like:
 !image-2021-08-10-10-55-50-317.png|width=73,height=86!
 # Add a *Copy Value From Other Field* Post-Functionon to the *Create* Transition on a Workflow with *Sub-Task* Issue Types.
 # Select the created *Select List (cascading)* Field on the Source/Destination Fields & select the *Copy from parent* option:
 !image-2021-08-10-10-58-05-746.png|width=331,height=127!
 # Addd the Post-Function & Publish the changes
 # Create a *Sub-Task* on an Issue with the *Select List (cascading)* Field with the option with no second level.

h3. Expected Results

The Sub-Task is created
h3. Actual Results

The Sub-Task is not created, the following error is displayed:
{quote}We can't create this issue for you right now, it could be due to unsupported content you've entered into one or more of the issue fields. If this situation persists, contact your administrator as they'll be able to access more specific information in the log file.
{quote}
h3. Workaround

The only workaround at this moment is to not use *Select List (cascading)* Fields with an option with no second level.
fields.summary: Creating a Sub-Task when the Copy Value From Other Field Post-Function is set for a Select List (cascading) Field is not working when is selected an option with no second value

fields.description: Right now it's too small and it prevents you from reading the full issue type name.
fields.summary: Improve inline task/subtask creator type selector dropdown

fields.description:
h3. Problem :

"Last Issue Update" column does not populate data as expected. It initially shows "No issues" until you toggle the sort button.
h3. Environment

Cloud.
h3. Steps to Reproduce :
 # Go to Jira settings>>Projects>>Manage Projects.
 # The "Last Issue Update" Column shows "No issues" 

h3. Expected Results

_Must display the time an issue was lastly updated within a project._
h3. Actual Results

_Displays "No issues" in the column field_
h3. Workaround

_Each time you login to the instance and navigate to "Manage Projects" Page, the Last issue Update column will show "No Issues" initially. To populate the data correctly, click on "Sort" buttons in the column._

_!image-2021-08-09-09-14-28-129.png!_
h3. Notes
fields.summary: "Last Issue Update" column does not populate data as expected.

fields.description:
Only users that currently have the "Trusted" role are able to use the "Share settings with an existing project" when creating a new project. 

It would be very useful if the *basic* role also has that option and also be able to create company-managed projects.

!Share settings with an existing project.png!
fields.summary: Make the "Share settings with an existing project" available for basic role

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Workflow condition "Value field" evaluates `Epic link` field even if only `Linked issues` field specified.

If a workflow condition "Value field" set up in the way that it's supposed to block certain transitions on issues without linked issues, it never blocks transitions if Epic link is set.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a workflow condition "Value field" to block a transition if an issue doesn't have linked issue
 # Choose Field: Linked issues, Condition: 
 # !Screen Shot 2021-08-10 at 11.26.27 am.png|width=749,height=241!
 # Save the condition and publish the workflow
 # !Screen Shot 2021-08-10 at 11.31.40 am.png|width=355,height=53!
 # Go to an issue that doesn't link with other issues but has Epic link field filled.
 # !Screen Shot 2021-08-10 at 11.34.16 am.png|width=351,height=237!
 # Check for transitions
 # !Screen Shot 2021-08-10 at 11.35.42 am.png|width=225,height=174!

h3. Expected Results

The transition that has the condition shouldn't appear in the transition list.
h3. Actual Results

The transition that has the condition appears in the transition list.
h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Workflow condition "Value field" evaluates more than the specified field

fields.description:
h3. Problem

Using Value Field condition by option ID don't work for cascading select field.

It does for Select List (single choice) field type but not for cascading.

 
h3. Why This Is Important

If the text for an option changes, the String comparison won't work, that's why the Option ID is important in order to validate a cascading field.
h3. Workaround

Use String comparison or add-ons from Atlassian Marketplace that enhance and enable such scenario.
fields.summary: Using Value Field condition by option ID don't work for cascading select field

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Automation rules page fails to load with the error _Something's gone wrong. Our team has been notified. If the problem persist, please contact Atlassian Support_

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Go to your Jira instance, Jira Settings (cog wheel on the top bar) and System.
 # Select *Automation rules*
 # Wait for it to load

Note: *This is only reproducible with more than five thousand automation rules*

h3. Expected Results
The page loads and your automation rules are displayed

h3. Actual Results
Sometimes the page does not load and an error is shown.
_Something's gone wrong. Our team has been notified. If the problem persist, please contact Atlassian Support_
Analyzing the requests made between the browser and the server, we highlight one:
{code}GET https://automation.atlassian.com/pro/rest/GLOBAL/rule/config{code}
ending in a 504 Gateway Timeout response.

h3. Workaround
 Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Automation rules fail to load intermittently

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

if you have 2 customs fields with a similar name, in the issue search, will only be displayed one of the fields and will also export just one field to excel, in the other the value will show as null:   

 
 !image-2021-08-09-16-25-52-310.png!
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # create 2 custom fields with a similar name
 # go to your issue search, add columns to each field                                                                                         !image-2021-08-09-16-26-30-875.png|thumbnail!
 # only one field will show up as a column                                                        !image-2021-08-09-16-26-47-255.png!

h3. Expected Results

both columns should be added
h3. Actual Results

only one column is added
h3. Workaround

Currently, the customer will have to edit the custom field's name
fields.summary: having 2 custom fields with similar name, causes an issue in JQL columns and excel exporting

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Issue field values are not recognized when *Issue Comment Edited* trigger is used 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create an automation rule using the *Issue Comment Edited* trigger
 # Use the following smart value to fetch the value of a text field
{code}
 {{issue.fields.Customfield_12345}}
{code}
 # The automation rule fails to fecth the value. No value is shown even using the *Log Action* action

h3. Expected Results
Issue field values should recognize when *Issue Comment Edited* trigger is used 

h3. Actual Results
Issue field values are not recognized when *Issue Comment Edited* trigger is used 

h3. Workaround
No workaround
fields.summary: Issue field values are not recognized when *Issue Comment Edited* trigger is used

fields.description:
Currently, it is not possible to change the size/width of the column in the advanced issue search page.
Users would like to have the ability to change the column width in the advanced issue search page.
fields.summary: Ability to resize the column width in the advanced issue search page.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

If the instance has two or more fields with the same name and type, the issue search shows the field options of all fields combined.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create two Select list custom fields with the same name 
 # Define different field options for each field
 # On Issue Basic Search, click on +More and add the field created
 # When trying to filter by the selected field, the field options of all fields are displayed combined, even if the field context is applied to a specific project. 

h3. Expected Results
It should show all fields to be selected in the +More dropdown
h3. Actual Results

Field options are displayed combined

h3. Workaround

To work around that, it's possible to Switch to JQL and search by the field ID, which is unique. Once the JQL is run, you can switch back to the Basic Search and show the correct field values.

{code:java}
cf[CustomFieldID] = value
{code}
fields.summary: Filter results show custom field options combined when a field is duplicated

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When we click on the View all starred filters option on the top bar menu, Jira displays the All Filters instead.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a filter and Star it
# On the top bar, click on Filters > All starred filters

h3. Expected Results
Jira should display only the starred filters

h3. Actual Results
Jira is displaying all the filters on the following URL:
* YOUR_INSTANCE.atlassian.net/jira/filters

h3. Workaround
Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: When clicking on All Starred filters, Jira display the All filters instead

fields.description:
Hi

Time and time again, we are faced with the need to transfer some users to another domain. This happens because we work with different dominions and people change from one to the other.

Is it possible to automatically transfer all work log of users to a new account? Old accounts will be blocked.

 

This post that presents a solution is not for Jira Cloud. [https://community.atlassian.com/t5/Jira-questions/Move-work-logs-to-another-user/qaq-p/928894] but you can see the number of times viewed.

 

Thank you.

Marcelo
fields.summary: Move work logs to another user

fields.description:
Please build a dark theme. Your website is blinding, and using third-party extensions is unacceptable.

Thank you
fields.summary: Dark theme

fields.description: We would like to have the ability to set a point to every field filled in so that we can set a score for the issues and this score should be achieved before performing some actions (i.e. moving the ticket to another department or escalating the issue).
fields.summary: Add Issue Score for Jira

fields.description: As a Jira user who deals with many internal and external users. It would be nice to have a feature whereby users can send an email based on a 'keyword' configured on a project issue and that email is translated into an existing comment given that the user's email who sent it is a valid user in the project and is able to comment on that project issue. This way, the user doesn't need to know the issue key or reply to a Jira address. A configured mail handler would be configured on the project with options of a custom or system email address. So all the user needs to do is send an email to that address with a variable in either the subject or body of the email and that will automatically be added as a comment in an issue.
fields.summary: Comment on an existing issue via email by using a variables local to an issue in a project

fields.description:
{panel:title= Implementation of New Features Policy|titleBGColor=#e0efff}
(i)
At the moment, we can't set an ETA for this feature to be released, since there's a number of factors that determine how our product team prioritizes new features. Consider adding yourself as a watcher to be kept informed as to the state of this feature request moving forward. With that way, if our development team updates the ticket, you'll be notified via email.
 You can learn more by reading [Implementation of New Features Policy|https://confluence.atlassian.com/support/implementation-of-new-features-policy-201294576.html].
{panel}
h3. Problem Definition

Currently, the smart value *comment.body* expands mentioned user's *accountId* that is hard to understand for the recipients.
h3. Suggested Solution

Expand the most understandable field of the mentioned user, such as *displayName*.

Or, provide any Smart Value capturing the mentioned users in the comment.
h3. Workaround

None. Consider adding yourself as a watcher to be kept informed as to the state of this feature request moving forward. With that way, if our development team updates the ticket, you'll be notified via email.
fields.summary: Human-readable expansion with {{comment.body}}

fields.description: Currently if there are cookies saved with AP api these cookies are not send to the backend via the HTTP request, to the post function requests, webhooks...
fields.summary: Send cookies saved with AP api to webhooks requests

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Currently, you can edit the name of "general" tab but the changes will not be reflected to the issue view screen in company managed projects.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Go to the issue screen setting page
 # Rename the "General" tab to "TEST"
 # Go to the issue view screen

h3. Expected Results
The tab "TEST" is shown

h3. Actual Results
The tab "General" is shown

h3. Workaround
Create a now tab with the name "TEST" and move all fields from "General" to "TEST"
fields.summary: Unable to rename "General" field tab
